lexUnit.name: splutter.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: say in a rapid indistinct way.

sentence.text: ` I 'm not going to argue with you , " he spluttered , visibly shaken .
` This -- this is private ! " ' he spluttered .
` D'you realize , " she spluttered , ` that your bulldozers have gone slap through the chief water main ?
` Y'y'yes , " I spluttered , amazed once again by the accuracy of his telepathic probing .
` He 'll get no girls if he goes round dressed like that , " one spluttered .
` My face , " he spluttered , and reached for handfuls of the rest .
` Th-that 's b-blackmail , " she spluttered .
“ Listen , you … you … , ” she spluttered , “ I 've coped with everything you 've thrown at me today .
` God , Jesus , hell , " she spluttered .
` Oh , Fernando , " she spluttered , lowering her head with shame .
“ B-but this is m-monstrous … iniquitous ! ” spluttered Pugwash .
` Disgraceful , " spluttered Sukey .
` That is quite uncalled for , " spluttered Kevin .
` You 're jokin' ! " splutters Gordon , and they crack up .
Thomas Higham 's disappointment was obvious ; clearly he had hoped for denials and tears , and he scowled in earnest while his bailiff began to splutter excuses .
I splutter a laugh .
Jerry splutters mild protestations .
He winked at Margaret as the person at the other end of the line spluttered some apology or other .
` Thanks , " I spluttered to no one in particular , then concentrated hard on eating .
` They seem to like you here , " he spluttered through a slice of chocolate cake .
" I 'll kill him , " repeated Bigwig , spluttering through his fouled whiskers and clotted fur .
` Mark Hapgood , sir , " he managed to splutter out .
In a flash , she spluttered over the phone : " Gordon Tucker ! "
` Let me out of here ! " she spluttered helplessly as he tightened his arms about her slim figure , ignoring her struggles with contemptuous ease .
